clinical_study.brief_title: Step Away From Depression - Evaluation of a Pedometer Intervention With Inpatients With Major Depression
clinical_study.official_title: Step Away From Depression - Evaluation of a Pedometer Intervention With Inpatients With Major Depression - A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the use of pedometers can help depressive inpatients in psychiatric clinics to increase their level of physical activity. Therefore patients are given a pedometer and instructions how to raise their level of daily steps. Intervention group is compared with a control group that is receiving treatment-as-usual. The intervention is hypothesized to increase number of daily steps and have positive effects on mood, depression and anxiety.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in average number of steps per day
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Number of steps per day is objectively measured using accelerometry (ActiGraph GT1M)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in depressive symptoms - clinician rated
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Depressive symptoms are rated by a blind study employee using MADRS

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity is subjectively measured with the International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Physical activity is objectively measured using accelerometry (ActiGraph GT1M)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Psychopathological symptoms are measured by the Symptom Checklist 27 (SCL-27)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in health-related quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life is measured using the Short-Form Health Questionnaire (SF-12)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Depressive symptoms are measured using the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI II)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety symptoms are measured using the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-efficacy for physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-efficacy for physical activity is measured using six likert scaled items by Scholz, U., Sniehotta, F. & Schwarzer, R. (2005)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intention for physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Intention for physical activity is measured using two likert scaled items by Sniehotta, F. F., Schwarzer, R., Scholz, U., & Schüz, B. (2005)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self concordance of the motivation for physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Self concordance of the Motivation for physical activity is measured using the "Sport- und bewegungsbezogene Selbstkonkordanz Skala", which consists of 12 likert scaled items

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in outcome expectancies for physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome expectancies for physical activity are measured using 6 likert scaled items by Lippke S., Ziegelmann, J. P. & Schwarzer, R. (2005)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in planning and barrier planning for physical activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Planning and barrier planning for physical activity is measured using 8 likert scaled items by Sniehotta, F. F. et al. (2005) / Renner, B. (2007)

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of inpatient treatment (Number of days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of inpatient treatment is assessed at the end of inpatient treatment
From baseline (1.-3. day of inpatient treatment) to end of inpatient treatment (3 days before end of inpatient treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: General self-efficacy is measured using the General-Self-Efficacy Scale (GSE)

arm_group.description: Patients receive a pedometer and instructions how to raise their physical activity

intervention.description: Patients receive a pedometer with instructions how to raise their number of daily steps

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Major Depression, moderate to severe as main diagnosis
- Inpatient status
- Prospected inpatient treatment of at least 4 weeks
- Able to understand german
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physical disease or disability that makes it impossible to reach the goal 5000 steps per day
- Borderline personality disorder
- Bipolar Disorder
- Schizophrenia
- Anorexia Nervosa
- Dementia
- Psychotic Depression
- Pregnancy
- Acute suicidality
- Substance dependancies with actual consumption (except nicotine)
- Current pedometer-use
- More than 10.000 steps per day
